parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear brake system can cause the vehicle to lose braking power, leading to increased stopping distances, accidents, or loss of control.
symptoms: The brake pedal feels soft or spongy
the brake pedal travels to the floor
the vehicle takes longer to stop
abnormal grinding sounds when braking
the brake wear sensor indicates worn brake pads
the parking brake light stays on.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The delamination of brake pad material can cause the brake pads to fail, leading to a loss of braking power and potentially causing accidents.
symptoms: The parking brake light stays on
the brake pads are found to have delaminated material
loose parts are found inside the brake drum
the brake pads are worn unevenly.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Brake fluid leaks can cause the brake system to fail, leading to a loss of braking power and potentially causing accidents.
symptoms: Brake fluid is leaking from the vehicle
the brake pedal feels soft or spongy
the vehicle takes longer to stop.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden and unexpected separation of the tire tread can cause loss of control, accidents, and damage to the vehicle and surrounding property, potentially leading to serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: Tire blowout
tire tread separation
loss of air pressure
wobbling or vibrating of the vehicle
damage to the wheel well
trim
and surrounding components.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The blower motor catching fire can cause damage to the vehicle's electrical system and potentially lead to a larger fire, posing a risk to the driver and passengers.
symptoms: The blower motor catches fire
smoke or flames are visible from the HVAC system.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The brake system failure can cause the vehicle to lose stopping power, leading to accidents or near-misses, especially when towing a trailer.
symptoms: Brake squeaking
brake system does not stop the vehicle properly
trailer brake gain control needs to be adjusted to high levels
service trailer brake system warning message on the dash display.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Defective Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) Regeneration and DEF Heater
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The defective DPF regeneration and DEF heater can cause the engine to lose power, potentially leading to accidents or loss of control, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: Engine power reduction
trouble code thrown by the ECM
engine power reduction at various speeds (65 mph
55 mph
45 mph
etc.)
DEF tank and internal heating element need to be replaced.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fan pulley can cause the fan belt to snap, leading to engine overheating, which can result in costly repairs, engine damage, or even engine failure. Additionally, the inability to turn off the engine when overheated can cause further damage and increase the risk of a fire.
symptoms: Fan pulley breaks in half
fan belt snaps
engine overheats
engine fails to turn off when overheated
temperature gauge rises
engine warning lights illuminate.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the remote start system can cause inconvenience, delay, and potentially lead to engine damage or failure if the engine is not properly started and monitored.
symptoms: Engine fails to start remotely
engine warning lights illuminate
engine starts manually but with issues.
